sermons.title: (Blood Covenant) 4 - The War Against the Covenant
(Godly Home) Part 15 - Father - the Anointed Teacher
sermons.description: Brother Denny exhorts fathers in their God-appointed role to "live on the edge of the impossible" by trusting God to work through them.  He shares on six holy qualities a father must have to effectively teach his children.  Kenaston strongly advocates making family devotions a top priority and shares from personal experience how the Lord has wrought godliness in his home through adopting that.

sermons.title: (Godly Home) Part 28 - The overtaking Blessings on the Second Generation
sermons.description: Daniel Kenaston (Denny Kenaston's eldest son, a missionary to West Africa) shares what it was like growing up under the biblical principles of the godly home.  Daniel encourages parents to seek God's best for their children and to be like Caleb who fought for the next generation.  Says young Kenaston, "Your children will fly where you walked because of the foundation you've given them."

sermons.title: (Guidelines) Meditate on the Bible
sermons.description: The Word of God is to be before His children continually. We should write the word on our doorposts, and the gates of our homes, and everywhere we live. McGee recalls a conversation he had with an advertising executive from Coca Cola about how serious the world is in reinforcing its message everywhere. In practical ways he suggests using car travel time, or bedtime for additional Bible time.

sermons.title: (How to Get Out of a Religious Rut): Awakened Out of Sleep
(How to Get Out of a Religious Rut): Errors in Thinking
(How to Get Out of a Religious Rut): It's Imperative to Get Out of the Rut NOW!
(How to Get Out of a Religious Rut): Rote, Rut, and Rot!
(The Role Of Demons In Today's Society) Part 4
(The Role Of Demons In Today's Society) Part 5
(Through The Bible) Deuteronomy 1-4
sermons.description: The word Deuteronomy means the second law. It is Moses final address to people and probably accounts of the final month and a half of Moses life.  He is rehearsing the accounts and past of Israel many of the people that were raised were not raised in Egypt. All these events in Deutoromy happen in the last 40 days of Moses life, they are words of encouragement before they cross over into the land. A part of the wilderness experience was legitiment, but most of the wilderness experience was illegitimate! They had to cross through the wilderness to get into Israel but not to stay there beyond what was necessary to get through to the promised Land. The promised land, the live of victory and freedom is God’s will for us to come into that life which is an life of the Spirit. We need to put aside the flesh walk and get into the life of the Spirit, God does not want us to spend our whole life in the wilderness. The life of the Spirit begins with the death of the old man, which is a step of faith, reckon your old man dead in Christ. The flesh and spirit are contrary, each of them are seeking supremacy and to rule our life’s.

sermons.title: (Through The Bible) Deuteronomy 17-20
sermons.description: What people give to God should not be castoffs. There should not be given something to God that doesn’t cost us but rather something should be given to God that costs us. Jesus watching the mite that gave out of her lively hood and substance he said she gave more then all! Nations that have been great got corrupted by the inside instead of being conquered from the outside. God ordered that idolatorship worship should result in stoning. That way the nation of Israel was kept pure and towards the One true God so that the nation was persevered. People were to get 2-3 witnesses if something was worshipping an idol and then they were stoned for the punishment. The Nation of Israel was to be an Theocracy which was God who was the King and God ruled over it. God knows what He is talking about, we have to realize that our thinking and our solutions really are not above the rules and punishments that God has put in place. As God has stated it how it should be.

sermons.title: (Through The Bible) Deuteronomy 21-25
sermons.description: The firstborn son always got the inheritance. You could never change the inheritance to any other children no matter how much you love them. If the son was rebellious you could stone him. Any man that was hung on a tree was cursed of God. Christ hanged on a tree and become the curse for us so that we may not be cursed by God at all if we are in Christ. There was an crown of thorns on Jesus and it was from the curse. So Christ taking on the curse upon him almost literally. If you saw your brothers Ox go astray then you should bring it back to your brother or keep it in your house until he goes to seek for it. If you find something that is lost you should seek to restore it to the prior owners. An women is not to wear men’s apparel or vice versa it is accounted as an abomination to God. If an women is raped in the field the man was put to death, but if in a place were people could hear both would be put to death because she did not scream. This gives an picture of how morally astute people were in Israel in those days.

sermons.title: (Through The Bible) Deuteronomy 26-29
sermons.description: In a few months Moses is going to go up into the mountain and die. He is rehearsing again the conditions that Gods blessings would be given in this new promised land. Moses is about to give over leadership to Aaron.  God is now established an new covenant with man which is through Jesus Christ which enables us to experience all the blessings of God. The burnt offerings were the offerings of consecration, the peace offering was the offering of our communion with God. God says if they hearken diligently to observe and to do all that they were commanded then they would be fruitful in the land and would be set high among all the nations in the earth. They would be ‘blessed’ among people of the earth. In America today we are enjoying the benefits of an nation that was founded on the need and centrality of God in the national life. And the nation did become prosperous and strong but now we are forsaking these ways and many leaders who believe we should not have God in charge of our life’s and country.

sermons.title: (Through The Bible) Deuteronomy 30-34
sermons.description: Prophecy of Jesus that will be fulfilled in His glory, then the angels will go out and gather Gods people from the four corners of the earth. The will return as the messiah to gather the people from the four corners of the earth. This is from Matthew 24:31, that is why many that focus their ministry in the new testament miss from the old testament the context they need to have for these prophecies. Salvation is as close to you as you could imagine. It is not something that we have to achieve by tremendous effort and energy. It is as close to us as confessing and believing, its an easy thing. Anyone can be saved in this very moment by just confessing and believing in Christ. Jesus I believe you rose from the dead. Believing is a matter of choice, you can choose to believe that Jesus rose from the dead.

sermons.title: (Through The Bible) Deuteronomy 5-8
sermons.description: The Lord talked to the people face to face. He is the God that brought the people out of the land of bondage. There is a repetition of the ten commandments in these chapters.  O that the people would hear me and obey me, God laments over us wanting to do so many things through us. He loves us so much and wants to demonstrate his love towards us. Our heart needs to be towards Him so that He can do many things through us! One compound unity, and absolute unity is the 2 words that are used in Hebrew for 1. The compound unity one is what God is being referred to saying “God is one Lord” which is part of the SHMA, the heart of Judaism doctrine which refers to the trinity of God. God keeps an book of remembrance of everything that we speak to friends and people, we need to talk about God and Jesus more in our life’s. Keeping the consciousness of God in our daily life. God is an jealous God so we should not tempt God but live towards Him. We should diligently keep the commandments of God and the statutes that it may be well of us. We have to take time to explain things to children because God has given children the power to question and ask questions about God.

sermons.title: (Through The Bible) Deuteronomy 9-16
sermons.description: Deuteronomy is an rehearsal and an capsulation of the law that Moses had given before. Gods eyesight did not dwindle but at 120 years it was still perfect. God said to Moses that he would not be able to enter into the promised land. God says that Israel is to enter into this land and enter and take cities and peoples greater then them. But before they had the same word from God but they had fear 40 years earlier they had 40 years in the wilderness till the whole generation passed away. God was greater then the greatest obstacle they could face. It is foolish to look at things without for what they are but at the same time we need to look beyond the problems to the sustaining power of God. When we get too close to problems we can lose sight of God. Self righteousness so easily attaches to us, there is something so perverse about our nature is that we want to make people think we are more righteous then we are. We want people to think we are spiritual giants.

sermons.title: 39. What is the duty which God requireth of man?
46. What is required in the first commandment?
5. Are there more Gods than one?
50. What is required in the second commandment?
51. What is forbidden in the second commandment?
56 Principle 52- The Practice of Teaching Children
sermons.description: All churches have been bulldozed in North Korea except for a few show churches in the main capital of North Korea. Christians practice their faith in secrecy and constant danger. Religious prisoners are often subjected to harsher treatment and given the most dangerous tasks, all to force them to renounce their faith. When they refuse, they have often been tortured to death. Likewise their children are sentenced to hard labor and starved to death.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 56. What is the reason annexed to the third commandment?
A CALL TO US
sermons.description: God is the same yesterday, today, and tomorrow. Therefore, what He revealed to His people through Moses many years ago, still applies, “He is a holy, jealous God.” What does this mean?

sermons.title: A CALL TO US
sermons.description: God is the same yesterday, today, and tomorrow. Therefore, what He revealed to His people through Moses many years ago, still applies, “He is a holy, jealous God.” What does this mean for us? This meditation will explain this.

sermons.title: A Living Hope - Part 5
sermons.description: The date delivered was 11/01/1958. The scriptures used in this sermon were Deuteronomy 8:2 and Philippians 3:13.

sermons.title: A Way Known Only To God
sermons.description: The Lord wants his people to rejoice in his presence which is only possible if you are walking with him in confidence of your acceptance with him. We don't know the journey God is taking us but he does. God will test and prove his people along this journey as he did Israel in the wilderness to see if we will believe and obey him. He wants us not living on bread (prosperity) promises alone, but by every promise in the Word of God. To not fully trust God is to strip him of all he wants to be and can be to us and bring him down to the level of a dead idol. It's a grievous sin in God's eyes to have unbelief, and the church needs to realize it.

sermons.title: Are the Giants Really Necessary?
sermons.description: August 16, 2009 - What do you do when you find giants occupying the very land that God promised is yours? Have you ever asked yourself, "if God is with us why do I face such violent opposition?" Are these obstacles and giants necessary? Obstacles and giants are placed on our path to teach us that we are not God. He is, and in and of yourself there is no strength to defeat these enemies. The Word of God promises that God Himseld will fight for us! Victory comes when we stand against these giants in the power of the Holy Spirit for the glory and honor of God's Name!

sermons.title: Being Spiritually Insensitive
sermons.description: One of the most astonishing statements in the Bible describing the possibility of being physically alive and yet virtually dead in the soul. Why would this be true of us? Here are the reasons, and what may be done to find life, through the measures God has taken.

sermons.title: Building Up My Brother's House
sermons.description: (preached: Dec. 12, 2002)

sermons.title: Desert Survival Series Pt 1- Moses The Man of God
Desert Survival Series Pt 31- Moses The Servant of God
Don't Be Dismayed by Carter Conlon
sermons.description: Carter Conlon preached this powerful message in the year 2003 at Times Square Church. No matter your struggle - God will NOT fail you as you trust Him in everything. God will always be faithful the scripture says. God has made covenant with the Church as he did with Israel and His promises are sure. He is a sure rock and fortress in our times of trouble. May God bring us to total dependence on Christ and His work.

sermons.title: Don't Be Dismayed, God Will Not Fail You
sermons.description: Carter Conlon preached this powerful message in the year 2003 at Times Square Church. No matter your struggle - God will NOT fail you as you trust Him in everything. God will always be faithful the scripture says. God has made covenant with the Church as he did with Israel and His promises are sure. He is a sure rock and fortress in our times of trouble. May God bring us to total dependence on Christ and His work.

sermons.title: Fear of God
sermons.description: Harold Vaughn preaches about the amazing presence of God.  How the Israelites saw the glory of God, heard His voice, and witnessed numerous miracles that only God could do… and yet after all of these things they feared circumstances more than they feared God.

sermons.title: Growing in the Grace of God #03 - The Old Covenant of Law
Growing in the Grace of God #04 - The Old Covenant of Law
How to Keep And Maintain the Blessings of God
Its not blind faith
sermons.description: Mark Cahill presents the solid truth that God is real and the Bible is His truth from history, archaeology, mathematical probability and science.  He labors to prove from the Ten Commandments that every man is guilty before God and needs Jesus Christ.  Do you have Jesus Christ through surrendering your life to Him?

sermons.title: New Life Baptist Church - Part 5
sermons.description: This is an important message for any father who desires to bring his children up in the ways of the Lord. Encouraging, yet challenging, Paul advises the listener to examine the Word of God and what it says about biblical manhood and how it applys to being a father. In this way, a man through his own example of Christ likeness can raise his son in what it means to walk as a godly man.

sermons.title: Oh America, What Will Be Your Destiny - Part 1
REMEMBER!
sermons.description: Perhaps we have experienced God’s reality at some time in our lives; but then innumerable other experiences followed so that we simply forgot about what He had done. Kanaan is the home of the Evangelical Sisterhood of Mary, an international, interdenominational organization founded in 1947 within the framework of the German Evangelical (Protestant) Church. Website: www.kanaan.org

sermons.title: Recognizing And Dealing With Occult Involvement
sermons.description: Bill Mcleod clearly deals with the subject of the occult in this message. He exposes much of the practices that Christians are involved in and shows how to get biblical deliverance. This is a great message to burn and hand out to those you feel could be involved in any areas of occult.

sermons.title: Sinners in the Hands of an Angry God
sermons.description: Considered to be one of the most famous sermons in American history, "Sinners in the Hands of an Angry God" was first delivered in Enfield, Connecticut on July 8, 1741. Timely yet timeless, Edwards shows us our true nature, that nature which we see so very clearly even today. Deuteronomy 32:35

sermons.title: Sinners in the Hands of an Angry God (alternate)
sermons.description: Enfield, Connecticut July 8, 1741 'Their foot shall slide in due time.' Deut. 32:35 In this verse is threatened the vengeance of God on the wicked unbelieving Israelites, who were God's visible people, and who lived under the means of grace; but who, notwithstanding all God's wonderful works towards them, remained (as ver. 28.) void of counsel, having no understanding in them. Under all the cultivations of heaven, they brought forth bitter and poisonous fruit; as in the two verses next preceding the text. The expression I have chosen for my text, Their foot shall slide in due time, seems to imply the following doings, relating to the punishment and destruction to which these wicked Israelites were exposed.

sermons.title: The Ark Of The Covenant
sermons.description: July 18, 2004 - The Ark represents the Presence of God. God Says “you will never take my presence lightly.” The most important thing in the life of a believer is the presence of Jesus Christ. The hiddeness of the revelation of Jesus Christ is found in the Presence of God.

sermons.title: The Compassion of God
sermons.description: The issue of mercy, not as an exertion of the moment, but what we are through and through is the thing that God is after in the Church—the word made flesh. Who are the “servants” whose pity for Israel’s ruins releases the Lord to rise up and have compassion on her, because the set time to favor Zion has come?

sermons.title: The Insignificant Person Is Important To God
sermons.description: It doesn’t matter where you go or how far you drift from the Lord – God will go after you. And when your heart turns to the Lord - you will find Him right next to you. Its in those times when you feel so insignificant that God will reveal your importance to Him.

sermons.title: The Lord Will Fight For You
The One Whom My Soul Loves
sermons.description: Have you found the one that your soul loves? Do you love Him more than your parents, your pastor or your counselor. When satan tempted the Lord, Jesus answered Him from Godâ€™s Word. He first answered him that man shall not live by bread alone but by every word that proceeds from the mouth of God. He also answered that you shall worship the Lord your God and Him alone you shall serve. And also that you shall not tempt the Lord your God (Matt 4). We must also find daily bread from Him; that we partake of Him that He brings that daily beauty and sweetness into our lives.

sermons.title: The Scandal of Specificity
sermons.description: The world hates a God who is specific about the things He chooses, for example, the nation Israel (the least of all peoples), Zion (a tiny hill - not a mountain), a stable (the birthplace of Messiah) and Calvary (a garbage dump) for the greatest revelation of Himself. A God who chooses is central to an understanding of the faith. Another incisive expression of God's choice of Israel with an excellent 'questions and answers' session at the end.

sermons.title: The Voice of Jesus Blood
sermons.description: All life is God’s Life and all Life is in the Blood. When innocent blood is spilled -- like Abel’s -- it cries out to God and God hears its voice. When Jesus came to earth, the sin of man’s spilling of blood ran in His holy veins. But Christ’s Blood cries out to the Father in our behalf because His is the Blood of the ultimate sacrifice for our sins, not the blood of a murdered man.

sermons.title: Through The Bible - Deuteronomy
sermons.description: Deuteronomy has three messages that make us look in different directions: look back at God's faithfulness, look up at Jesus, and look forward.  This repetition of the law reinforces God's heart in many areas, such as obedience in small commandments, requirements for spiritual leaders, dangers of prosperity and false prophets.

sermons.title: Ungodly Practice of Dating
sermons.description: In this message Tim Conway strongly speaks on the GOD ordained headship of the family. Fathers taking their rightful place to protect their daughters.Referring to old testament scriptures, we are shown the will of GOD concerning dating and marriage. A recommended message for all parents.

sermons.title: Visiting the Iniquity of the Fathers
What To Do When The Stock Market Falls!
Your Enemies are Beginning to Tremble
sermons.description: June 12,2005 - The moment we rise up to begin to move in to possess the land that God has promised us. This land of course is Jesus Christ and His life within us – at this moment we move forward there is a report of us that goes through the realm of spiritual darkness and hell begins to know our name. Its God’s destiny to take the weakest of His saints and give us the glorious resurrection life and power of Jesus Christ that will cause your enemies to tremble.
